name: Gen AI CC Knowledge Management
description: GenAI-powered knowledge management solution for contact center agents in a financial services organization, focused on improving policy/procedure lookup and answer generation during live customer interactions. Built as a scalable RAG application with reusable platform components (ingestion, retrieval, security/guardrails, evaluation, and an AI gateway) to extend beyond the Care Center into other operations and functions.

name: L&T AI
description: A multi-application enterprise AI program for Larsen & Toubro (L&T) that delivered high-impact AI use cases across EPC operations and support functions over ~18 months. The delivery included composite AI applications for project execution, equipment planning, workmen planning/compliance, procurement vendor optimization, and multiple HR assistants, built with agentic orchestration, RAG, ML optimization, and Azure-based deployment.

name: Agentic AI MVP Build
description: Paychex’s payroll operations receive a very high volume of payroll instructions via email, creating costly and error-prone manual processing. Bain built and deployed an agentic AI system that classifies and validates inbound emails, resolves account context, generates payroll submissions via internal systems, and produces customer-ready responses, supported by rigorous testing, shadow-mode experimentation, and a Control Tower for transparency.

name: Digico Data & AI CoE and value deliv
description: Bain supported PLDT in defining and scaling its digital services entity ("DigiCo") and the underlying data-and-AI platform initiative ("Kayana"). The work set a five-year business roadmap and revenue/valuation ambition while enabling early product commercialization and GenAI/ML proof-of-concepts on an AWS-based data ecosystem.

name: AI-powered project schedule
description: SAIPEM (also referred to as the AIS J5HN Planner / AI Project Schedule) is an AI-assisted scheduling and decision-support application built for Saipem to accelerate early project planning during the bidding (ITT/RFP) phase. It combines rule-based schedule generation with historical-project inference and a GenAI chatbot that answers schedule and procurement questions via natural-language-to-SQL. Wave 1 focuses on onshore projects and produces Primavera-compatible schedules with durations, dependencies, and man-hour estimates.

name: Project Aiden Phase 4
description: AIDEN is Unilab’s enterprise GenAI-powered business intelligence platform, delivering a unified suite of applications across finance, procurement, master data management, and commercial market intelligence. The platform combines a shared Next.js frontend with multiple FastAPI backends, a data platform for ingestion and conformed assets, and LLM-enabled features including chat assistants, insight generation, semantic search, and agentic workflows.
